It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a short, thick stem and a dense cluster of leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish in color, which bloom during the wet season. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Scelochilus palatinus is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
